intro: Mundia heterophylla, commonly known as the variable-leaf mundia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its variable leaf shapes, ranging from ovate to linear, depending on environmental conditions. Its small white flowers are typically arranged in clusters and bloom during the rainy season. The plant is often found in moist, shaded areas such as forest understories and rocky outcrops.
